Size: Up to 40 cm wide or tall.
Stem: Wiry. Smooth or slightly hairy. Brown or reddish. Able to take root at nodes.
Leaves: Oppositely arranged, flat, linear, 2-6 cm long. Smooth or finely toothed edges.
Flowers: Tiny whitish, in large oblong clusters at the base of leaves.
FruitSeeds: Tiny heart shaped. Do not open to release seeds.
Habitat: Native to all Australian states and territories. Riparian areas, swamps, woodlands, grasslands.
DistinguishingFeatures: Distinguished from non-native Khaki weed (*Alternanthera pungens*) by narrower leaves and less hairy stems.
